column4: hey, is there a way to change my swap-space after installing ubuntu?
hey, is there a way to change my swap-space after installing ubuntu?
what do you mean by change?
I need more swap space to run Oracle

you can use the live cd to do it regardless of the situation. If you need to take space from one of the active partitions, you won't be able to without using the live cd because it requires deactivating them
will it hurt my current install?
no
and this is partitioning we're talking about, right?
yeah, all you would have to do is resize a partition adjacent to the swap, then resize the swap to take up the newly made free space
cool. thanks.
drag and drop although some of them aren't formatted properly
pretty sure there isn't
too bad. that is deffinately needed.
just don't use the desktop. I don't have anything on the desktop. Thunar will do it
yeah, but this pc is for my GF. She's used to windows.
open up thunar and then go to the desktop with that
yeah, I'll probably do that instead. just trying to stay away from gnome and its fat ass.
do you know if xubuntu ships the xfce compositor that allows stuff like drop shadows?
doubt it
but don't know
maybe #xubuntu will know
k
dpkg --get-selections
thx
